intro: Lappula saxatilis, commonly known as the rock lappula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant that typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Lappula saxatilis is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is adapted to harsh, arid environments.
